headline: Easy 5-Ingredient Salmon
description: This easy salmon recipe delivers big flavor with just a few pantry and fridge staples. Pan-searing in butter browns the fillets but keeps them moist.

video.description: Super simple, super quick recipe for fresh salmon fillets!
video.name: Super Simple Salmon

name: Easy 5-Ingredient Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Stir garlic powder, basil, and salt together in a small bowl. Rub the mixture evenly over salmon.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add salmon and cook until browned and flaky, about 5 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: This is one of our favorite salmon recipes! It is always delicious.
For someone who doesn't cook , I relied on the title "Super Simple Salmon Recipe" and you did not disappoint! Delish and I will cook it again!
Quick and delicious. I substituted sea salt. But be careful about using too much.
This is my go-to Salmon recipe!!! I use frozen salmon and have tried it with many other types of fish. Really easy and quick and I could eat this every day of the week! LOVE IT!!!

First timer with this recipe-- this was the best salmon I ever ate-- including restaurants-- convincing me that yes I can do salmon once or twice a week... not only for health reasons but because it's so quick and delectable! thank you!
This was delicious! Simple and fast with awesome flavor. This is my go to recipe for Salmon in the future!
Squeezed an entire lemon onto salmon and in pan
So easy! I made this for me and my 2.5 year old, she approved :)

This is a very good and tasty salmon dish. 
I only crave salmon about once/ month, but this is my go to recipe Using aldi's Norwegian salmon seasonal special this weekend. 
Another reason I like this recipe is that its super simple!
This was very simple and still satisfying. I did not have any basil on hand and used a substitute Herbes de Provence. Served with fresh sautéed spinach.
Changed it up a little bit , came out delicious
Very nice,I lay the salmon on citrus slices and cover(no flipping)......only difference

Wow..we loved this..would make again..and again..
Made as written.

Super simple salmon is the perfect name for this recipe. There’s no marinade so no forethought. The ingredients are basic. It cooks in 10 minutes. The taste reminds me of blackened fish without the kick. I’ll certainly make this again and again.

I had been making the Brown Sugar and Dijon Mustard Glaze Salmon regularly but was looking for a change. This was just the thing! It was quick and delicious! And it didn’t require heating the oven on a hot summer day.
My go-to for tasty, quick and easy salmon. Thank you!!!
It was great and easy to make. It was delicious.

I enjoyed it very much. 

Thank you
This is fantastic! And so easy! I didn’t have basil so I used Italian seasonings. Otherwise followed recipe exactly. Put it on top of a spinach salad. Delicious!

Fabulous! I always follow recipes exactly when making for the 1st time. I'm not changing a THING! Honey, this is smack your Mamma good! I got the pan pretty hot &seared the salmon. It turned the dry rub into a super healthy blackening! Family was asking for more!! Kudos!

Listen not to the naysayers, good people! This was a delicious recipe. I had everything on hand except for lemon. I did add extra butter to the pan. Simple and delicious.... It doesn’t get any better than that!

Wow! I made this last night thinking, "this sounds easy, I have all the ingredients, and it has great reviews". Little did I know that this may become my favorite way to make salmon. I didn't change a thing and everyone thought it was delicious. Great, easy recipe!

My husband just made this for me using this recipe. The only change was he added a little dill. We had one big salmon steak and it was cooked crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside - just perfect! I told him it was as good as the salmon I always order at one of my favorite restaurants! Super simple is right! Can't get easier than this and it could be served in a restaurant!
Soooo good!! Simply delicious!
This was great and worked great!

First time I made salmon and it was WONDERFUL! So easy!! It didn’t take much time and it was so so good! It also smelled up my kitchen with such glorious smells. Everyone found their way to the kitchen as I was cooking. It was a great meal! Thank you so much!
Yes very simple quick, tasty and not fishy! This is a weeknight go-to!
Tasty and very simple
It was Amazing. Instead of basil i used herbs de Provence.and i used hymalayan sea salt.it came out PERFECT on a cast iron skillet. Thank you! Soooooo quick , flavorful and easy.
Cooked exactly as is in a cast iron skillet. Heated the butter at medium and then turned to low when I flipped the salmon so it wouldn’t smoke. It was the best salm9n I ever made.
I've made this a couple of times. Didn't change a thing and was an absolute hit.
Delicious!

Incredible taste. Easy fix .
I had to substitute Italian seasoning for basil but still a beautiful flavor.
First time making Salmon for myself. Easy to follow receipt ingredients were simple, prep was quick. I decided to freehand the amount of seasoning given I was using less fish. Taste was great!
Simple and delicious resipe. Very quick
Very easy and so tasty recipe!! I’ve always been intimidated to cook salmon but it turned out delicious and perfectly cooked. Easy to make during the weekday !
Terrible video, but the recipe is fine.
Delicious and super easy! My picky eater 12 year old even liked it. Will definitely make it again.
I just made this for my wife and myself. It was definitely easy and more importantly, it was delicious. I will definitely be making this again.
Very easy and delicious!
I just made this for my husband and I. I can’t believe how so few ingredients made such a tasty salmon dish. I will definitely be making this again!!!
I made 2 4oz filets, cut the recipe and baked for 12 minutes instead of 15. Perfect!
I added a little paprika and cayenne to spice it up a little but otherwise kept everything more or less the same. Very satisfied with the result.
Simple and delicious. I will definitely make it again when I don't want to spend too much time on the kitchen.
I just added 2 tbsp butter to the pan with garlic clove sliced and follow directions as described

Made it exactly like recipe. 
Just added about 1/2 black pepper. 
Family loved it. 
So quick and easy. 
Will make it again!
I used a black iron skillet. The rub and butter creates a nice blackened crust without the hot spice. Very easy and tasty.

I took a little bit of something from different reviews. This recipe is fantastic! For 1/2 pound of fillet, I used 1/2 tsp each of garlic powder and dried basil. Added 1/8 tsp. salt and 1/4 tsp. lemon pepper. Used that mixture as the rub. I had sautéed a large garlic clove, minced in the 2Tablespoons of butter before cooking the salmon per side 5 minutes- all in low heat. I used these measurements for 1 or 2 servings. Absolutely delicious!

This was a great recipe just as written.After an exhausting day during the COVID-19 pandemic working with my pastor this recipe was a wonderful break. I served it with roasted Yukon gold potatoes, cauliflower and bacon wrapped asparagus. It was yummy.

I made this, pretty good! Used frozen salmon had purchased previously, thawed for about 15 mins in cold water, and feeling kinda lazy decided to bake instead of pan fry.

Preheated the oven to 375, and instead of melting the butter, used a cooking pan lined with foil and put a slice of butter underneath and a slice above (after seasoning), baked my 6oz pc about 9 mins and finished with a squirt of lemon juice, and served on a bed of couscous.

Very tasty, and will make again!!

I don’t cook. I mostly order take-out or get pre-made food. Because of the coronavirus quarantine my family assigned each member to cook a homemade meal each night. I looked up this recipe and prayed that it was already. Much to my surprise my family LOVED it. I was in SHOCK. I usually burn my food, over season it, or just generally destroy it by accident.
My daughter doesn't usually like baked fish, but she ate this all up! My husband said well that was a great meal. I roasted brussel sprouts and cooked yellow rice with the salmon.
Absolutely scrumptious! So quick and simple to make.
Perfectly simple, flavor was great.

This was very easy and really delicious. I was out of basil so I substituted with a Italian seasoning. I like my salmon with a little extra lemon flavor so I added a table spoon of lemon pepper. This was so easy.
The recipe stands on its own merits, simple and straight forward. What more do you need? Our sides were asparagus and salad. Added french baguette and a nice chardonnay.
Simple recipe that is delicious.
Simple and excellent

Absolutely delicious and simple. I don't like too many ingredients with fresh fish - it overpowers it. I would rather have something simple that lets the flavors come through. This really fit the bill - good mix of flavors and easy to make but not overpowering.
Good and simple salmon recipe ! Will keep this.
My daughter loved this!!!!!!! It was the first time I have attempted to make salmon and it turned out wonderful!!!! Thank you!!!
Easy to make, quick and delicious.
Very easy and tasty!!
I measured the spices, but it was too salty for me.

I made this salmon and we really liked it. I squeezed some lemon over the filets when i flipped them over. Will surely make this again but cook it a little longer than the recipe says...thank you for the recipe
This was so simple but very good. Works well when u have a heavy side like pierogi.
Made it according to the recipe. Just used less butter to cook it. Loved it. Made twice already because it is so easy!
So easy, this was my first time preparing salmon
It was truly simple to put together. Haven't tasted it yet because it's still cooking but it smells delicious.

Looking for a new way to do salmon and the word easy popped out lol. I read a lot of the reviews and opted to use 1/4t salt, replaced basil w Italian seasoning and added some lemon pepper and Parmesan. I also followed someone else by cooking 4 min on each side and then moving to the broiler for a few minutes w some Panko. Everyone loved it! Served over some rice w vegetables.

Considering this was the first "meal" (I had some Uncle Ben's rice and ate the lemon for good measure) I was very proud of how it turned out!

I did deviate from the ingredients list by sauteeing a chopped up clove of garlic, which I had read in another comment before hand, and a slice of lemon with a little extra fresh-squeezed lemon juice (and a few sneaky seeds).

I think I overcooked it a little but it was well charred and that's the way. It was like being in my own restaurant.
Simple and super awesome..Never thought this simple recipe would be super delicious..
Quick, easy, and delicious! Will definitely make again!

Yes will make again. Added Salmon herb mixture to flavoring.
Served with pesto pasta (Papardelle)

Super easy and came out great. I dont even have anything but sea salt, but I dont think that is the key to the simplicity of this recipe. For me it was, that it was a very simple and quick way to make a great healthy dinner for my son and I. Steamed broccoli, an roasted baby red potatoes and I was in heaven, lol. 
Some lemon wedges on the plate for either the broccoli or salmon, and easy peasy. Ty for submitting
My family loved this recipe and asked me to make it again. I added minced garlic to the butter, and covered the pan after flipping it.
this recipe was very delish!!!
Simple and delicious.

What an easy and delicious way to fix salmon. We 
Are currently on the coast of Washington and good salmon is plentiful. We added fresh lemon at the table side but otherwise I used the recipe as written.
Love this! I'd cut down on the salt though. Otherwise, it's really tasty and quick to make!
Broiled it skin down for 5 minutes, flipped brushed with the melted butter to which I had added lemon juice. Even the 12 year olds ate it all up.
I’m new at cooking .. like really new haha and some dishes are some complicated but I LOVED this one! So easy to follow and it’s soooo yummy :)

I made this exactly as written. We loved it and I wouldn't change a thing. I had planned on a more complicated recipe, but I was tired and hungry and this looked so easy. It was! And so rewarding that my friend was impressed. Thanks for sharing this great recipe!
This recipe was great, I didn’t really follow amounts or the ingredients to a tee, I used a mix of oregano and basil along with Parmesan. But the cooking times and temps were just perfect.
Delicious. I used Penzy's Bicentennial Rub, and fried in Grapeseed Oil and Butter. Easy recipe:)
I followed instructions completely and when serving, I added a honey drizzle and a pepper sprinkle. The salmon is fantastic this way!
Simple but elegant! Will repeat! Served with wild rice & green salad with blue cheese dressing.
Did not care for the flavor. Nor did my husband. Won’t make again.

Simple and delicious! We are salmon lovers so this was an easy dinner night! Thank you!
***I have made this several times and it is always good! I mix up the herbs in a zip lock ( change up the seasonings to your liking) and shake the fish all around and throw it on the cast iron!
I just made this recipe as is and it was delicious! So good that my 2 and 4 year old even gobbled it up!

I left out the salt, didn't have any garlic on hand so used minced onion instead with the black pepper, basil, and added a touch of cinnamon. It blackened the top and bottom of the Salmon. the taste was very nice for my first time cooking a Salmon. a little dry on o e side of the fish. Still very good! Thank you for sharing your recipe.

I made this twice last week. Before making it I sprinkled the fillets all over with Kosher salt and some sugar. I let it sit at room temperature for about 20 minutes and then rinsed them off in ice water. 

From there I followed the recipe exactly and it was excellent! The next time I make it I will cut back a bit on the garlic powder.

This is really good and so simple. I added garlic to the butter. Not sure if I will do that again or not. The garlic got pretty dark before the salmon was cooked through. I pan fried, skin side up, first. Then flipped and grated some parmesan cheese over the top, after a few minutes, I flipped again and got a nice parmesan crispiness. It was really good!
love this recipe. added a spicy component to my liking.. I love it.
I followed recipe to the letter, very, very delicious. I will make it again.

Pretty good! It was simple, but had a nice flavor. I like to cook skin side first to get it crispy, and then just a little brown on top. It was an easy and quick way to get dinner on the table without feeling like you're punking out. Will probably use again.
I didn't change a thing!! Delicious, quick and easy!!!!
If I never cooked before this is a super helpful easy way to go.. ... nice job.

Truly as it easy and delicious as everyone has shared. I took the advice of one of the reviews and added Lemon pepper to the rub - and then topped it off with lemon slices while it was cooking. So good.
